idea: A 'Trivia Challenge' quiz web app that serves three purposes: 1) Help people assess their knowledge about Microsoft Fabric, 2) Demonstrate Azure and Microsoft Fabric technologies, 3) Serve as a booth animation during Microsoft Ignite event. Based on Fabric Flashcards, with Kahoot/Duolingo-inspired UX. Game includes waiting screen, registration, timed quiz gameplay with dynamic difficulty, and results/leaderboard. Features comprehensive telemetry capture sent to Microsoft Fabric for analysis.

project.name: Microsoft Fabric Trivia Challenge
project.mission: Create an engaging quiz game that helps people assess their Microsoft Fabric knowledge while demonstrating Azure and Fabric technologies at Microsoft Ignite
project.audience: Microsoft Ignite attendees and Microsoft Fabric learners
project.summary: A Kahoot/Duolingo-inspired quiz web app where players have a base 1 minute to answer randomized Microsoft Fabric questions, with the ability to earn up to 1 additional minute through completed streaks (maximum 2 minutes total). Difficulty is controlled by time pressure and number of answer choices. Features forgiving streak system and comprehensive telemetry including all user interactions.
constraints: Game must be playable with touch, mouse and keyboard only (ZCBM for answer choices)
Base 1 minute timer with streak bonuses up to 2 minutes total
Comprehensive telemetry: all clicks, mouse movements (max 10 points/sec), game events
Real-time telemetry capture to Microsoft Fabric
Support for 10 concurrent players initially, scalable to 80K
challenges: Real-time telemetry performance: Use batching and asynchronous processing to avoid impacting game performance
High concurrent users at Ignite: Implement proper scaling with Azure App Service and connection pooling for Cosmos DB
Touch vs mouse interaction differences: Thorough testing across devices and input methods with responsive design
Network latency affecting game experience: Implement offline-capable question caching and optimistic UI updates
Dynamic timer complexity: Careful testing of streak-based time bonus calculations and UI updates
Telemetry data volume: Use efficient data schemas and consider sampling strategies for mouse movement data

stack.name: Hosting
stack.details: Azure Static Web Apps (frontend) + Azure App Service Container (backend)

stack.name: Analytics
stack.details: Microsoft Fabric for real-time telemetry processing

clarifications.question: For the question content, you mentioned it's "based on Fabric Flashcards" - do you already have a collection of Microsoft Fabric questions prepared, or do you need help creating the question bank?
clarifications.answer: Yes I have them as a JSON file

clarifications.question: For the difficulty levels, how many levels are you planning and how should the difficulty progression work during gameplay?
clarifications.answer: Three levels, always start with easy, as you progress with streaks, you progress levels. There is a caveat to the streak: a wrong answer let you go back one step in the streak, not restart it.

clarifications.question: For the leaderboard and competition aspect, what should be the primary scoring mechanism?
clarifications.answer: Points weighted by difficulty level + time bonuses. The time bonuses must be proportional to the points weighted (we must not have more points from finishing early with 0 good answers rather than finishing last with 100% correct answers).

clarifications.question: For the "orange spooky wizards" visual theme, do you have specific design assets or visual references in mind?
clarifications.answer: Actually, I want that design (referring to Kahoot/Duolingo-style interface). We switched the theme to just mimic Kahoot/Duolingo

clarifications.question: For the Microsoft Fabric telemetry integration, do you need help setting up the Fabric workspace and what specific telemetry events would be valuable?
clarifications.answer: Yes I'm good on the Fabric part. Every touch or mouse move must be logged in (we can create heatmaps of clicks, replays of mouse movements, etc)

clarifications.question: For the React frontend setup, do you want to use any additional UI libraries beyond Tailwind CSS?
clarifications.answer: Yes, include shadcn/ui for component library

clarifications.question: What color scheme should be used for the frontend design?
clarifications.answer: Custom colors based on mockup: dark background, orange timer bar (#FFA500), vibrant answer buttons (green #10b981, blue #3b82f6, purple #a855f7, orange #f97316), white text, golden streak flasks (#fbbf24)

clarifications.question: Should keyboard mappings be A/K/S/L (as shown in mockup) or Z/C/B/M (as mentioned in constraints)?
clarifications.answer: Keep keyboard mappings configurable in a config file for easy modification later

clarifications.question: Can players resume an in-progress game session after leaving the playing screen?
clarifications.answer: No, leaving the game requires returning to registration and starting a new session

tasks.description: Create .NET 10 Minimal API with user session management and question serving endpoints
Set up React + TypeScript + Tailwind with Kahoot/Duolingo-inspired design
Implement randomized question loading from JSON file (no difficulty filtering)
Design Cosmos DB collections for users, sessions, questions, and scores
Implement 1-minute base timer with 15-second streak bonuses (up to 2 minutes total, max 4 streaks)
Implement the game screen with question display, answer buttons, timer bar, and streak indicators
Build waiting screen, registration, gameplay, and results screens
Implement touch, mouse, and keyboard controls (Z/C/B/M)
Implement comprehensive event tracking (clicks, mouse movements at 10 points/sec, game events)
Design and implement real-time leaderboard updates (daily and cumulative)
Set up real-time telemetry streaming to Microsoft Fabric
Configure Azure Static Web Apps and App Service Container deployment
Set up GitHub Actions for automated testing and deployment
Implement proper scaling for 10-80K concurrent users
Add application performance and error tracking
Test the application under Microsoft Ignite booth conditions
